Can only be called by the current owner."}},"title":"PuppyRaffle","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"changeFeeAddress(address)":{"notice":"only the owner of the contract can change the feeAddress"},"enterRaffle(address[])":{"notice":"this is how players enter the rafflethey have to pay the entrance fee * the number of playersduplicate entrants are not allowed"},"getActivePlayerIndex(address)":{"notice":"a way to get the index in the array"},"selectWinner()":{"notice":"this function will select a winner and mint a puppythere must be at least 4 players, and the duration has occurredthe previous winner is stored in the previousWinner variable"},"tokenURI(uint256)":{"notice":"this function will return the URI for the token"},"withdrawFees()":{"notice":"this function will withdraw the fees to the feeAddress"}},"notice":"This project is to enter a raffle to win a cute dog NFT. The protocol should do the following: 1. Call the `enterRaffle` function with the following parameters:    1. `address[] participants`: A list of addresses that enter. You can use this to enter yourself multiple times, or yourself and a group of your friends. 2. Duplicate addresses are not allowed 3. Users are allowed to get a refund of their ticket & `value` if they call the `refund` function 4. Every X seconds, the raffle will be able to draw a winner and be minted a random puppy 5. The owner of the protocol will set a feeAddress to take a cut of the `value`, and the rest of the funds will be sent to the winner of the baseURI().details: Returns the base URI set via {_setBaseURI}. This will be automatically added as a prefix in {tokenURI} to each token's URI, or to the token ID if no specific URI is set for that token ID.

params.newFeeAddress: the new address to send fees to

params._entranceFee: the cost in wei to enter the raffle
params._feeAddress: the address to send the fees to
params._raffleDuration: the duration in seconds of the raffle

params.newPlayers: the list of players to enter the raffle

params.player: the address of a player in the raffle

returns._0: the index of the player in the array, if they are not active, it returns 0

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

refund(uint256).details: This function will allow there to be blank spots in the array

params.playerIndex: the index of the player to refund. You can find it externally by calling `getActivePlayerIndex`

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

selectWinner().details: we use a hash of on-chain data to generate the random numberswe reset the active players array after the winner is selectedwe send 80% of the funds to the winner, the other 20% goes to the feeAddress

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: See {IERC165-supportsInterface}. Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

changeFeeAddress(address).notice: only the owner of the contract can change the feeAddress

enterRaffle(address[]).notice: this is how players enter the rafflethey have to pay the entrance fee * the number of playersduplicate entrants are not allowed

getActivePlayerIndex(address).notice: a way to get the index in the array

selectWinner().notice: this function will select a winner and mint a puppythere must be at least 4 players, and the duration has occurredthe previous winner is stored in the previousWinner variable

tokenURI(uint256).notice: this function will return the URI for the token

withdrawFees().notice: this function will withdraw the fees to the feeAddress
